div.l: The wenche rowted eke par company
Aleyn the clerke that hard this melody
He poked Iohn and sayde slepest thou
Hardyst thou euir suche a song or now
Lo whiche a coplyng is atwene them alle
A wylde fyre vpon their bodies falle
Who herde euir suche a farly thyng
Ye they shalhaue the floure of alle euyl endyng
This long nyght ther tyd me no rest
But yet no force alle shalbe for the best
For Iohn sayde aleyn so mot I thryue
If that I may yon wynche wyl I swyue
Some easement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a lawe that seyeth thus
That if a man in one thing be aggreued
That in a nother he shalbe releuyd
Oure corn is stole sothly it is no nay
And we haue hadde an euyl fyt to day
And sithen I shal haue non amendement
Agayns my losse I wylle haue easement
By cockes soule it shal none other be
This Iohn aunswerd aleyn auyse the
This myller is a parlous man he sayde
And if that he oute of his slepe abrayde
He myght do vs bothe a vylony
Aleyn aunswerd I count him naught a fly
And vp he roose and by the wenche he crept
This wenche lay vp right and fast slept
Tyl he so nygh was or she myght aspy
That it hadde be to late for to crye
And shortly for to telle they were at one
Now pley aleyn for I wyl speke of Iohn
This Iohn lieth stylle a furlong wey or two
